description: The operational meaning of a category of limits.

contents.name: acceptableDuration
contents.description: The nominal acceptable duration of the limit.  Limits are commonly expressed in terms of the a time limit for which the limit is normally acceptable.   The actual acceptable duration of a specific limit may depend on other local factors such as temperature or wind speed.

enumValues.name: high
enumValues.description: High means that a monitored value above the limit value is a violation.   If applied to a terminal flow, the positive direction is into the terminal.

enumValues.name: low
enumValues.description: Low means a monitored value below the limit is a violation.  If applied to a terminal flow, the positive direction is into the terminal.

enumValues.name: absoluteValue
enumValues.description: An absoluteValue limit means that a monitored absolute value above the limit value is a violation.

contents.name: limitType
contents.description: Types of limits defined in the ENTSO-E Operational Handbook Policy 3.

enumValues.name: patl
enumValues.description:
The Permanent Admissible Transmission Loading (PATL) is the loading in Amps, MVA or MW that can be accepted by a network branch for an unlimited duration without any risk for the material.
The duration attribute is not used and shall be excluded for the PATL limit type. Hence only one limit value exists for the PATL type.

enumValues.name: patlt
enumValues.description: Permanent Admissible Transmission Loading Threshold  (PATLT) is a value in engineering units defined for PATL and calculated using percentage less than 100 of the PATL type intended to alert operators of an arising condition. The percentage should be given in the name of the OperationalLimitSet. The aceptableDuration is another way to express the severity of the limit.

enumValues.name: tatl
enumValues.description:
Temporarily Admissible Transmission Loading (TATL) which is the loading in Amps, MVA or MW that can be accepted by a branch for a certain limited duration.
The TATL can be defined in different ways:

enumValues.name: tc
enumValues.description:
Tripping Current (TC) is the ultimate intensity without any delay. It is defined as the threshold the line will trip without any possible remedial actions.
The tripping of the network element is ordered by protections against short circuits or by overload protections, but in any case, the activation delay of these protections is not compatible with the reaction delay of an operator (less than one minute).

enumValues.name: tct
enumValues.description: Tripping Current Threshold  (TCT) is a value in engineering units defined for TC and calculated using percentage less than 100 of the TC type intended to alert operators of an arising condition. The percentage should be given in the name of the OperationalLimitSet. The aceptableDuration is another way to express the severity of the limit.

enumValues.name: highVoltage
enumValues.description:
Referring to the rating of the equipments, a voltage too high can lead to accelerated ageing or the destruction of the equipment. 
This limit type may or may not have duration.

enumValues.name: lowVoltage
enumValues.description:
A too low voltage can disturb the normal operation of some protections and transformer equipped with on-load tap changers, electronic power devices or can affect the behaviour of the auxiliaries of generation units.
This limit type may or may not have duration.
